definition: threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams

sentences.english: To set the film in an abattoir is itself devious.
sentences.chinese: 把故事安排在屠场，是别有用心的。

sentences.english: I will bring them down like lambs to the slaughter, and like rams with kids.
sentences.chinese: 我必使他们下到屠场，无异羔羊绵羊和山羊。

sentences.english: We knew it was an abattoir when we arrived.
sentences.chinese: 我们知道在我们到达之前那是一个屠场。

sentences.english: You observe the genesis of my abattoir.
The cows were moved to abattoir and be killed for their meats.
sentences.chinese: 母牛被移动了向屠场和为他们的肉被杀害。

sentences.english: Rufino earns some money doing hard and dirty work, such as moving meat around a slaughterhouse .
sentences.chinese: 罗干辛苦和肮脏工作来谋生，比如在屠场搬肉。

sentences.english: "The scene was like a slaughterhouse, " Liu said between tears.
sentences.chinese: “这场景简直是人间屠场，”刘流着眼泪说。

definition: hell on earth (idiom); suffering the torments of Buddhist hell while still alive/fig. having an uncomfortable time
flesh and blood flying (idiom); carnage/people blown to pieces
enough blood flowing to float pestles (idiom); rivers of blood/blood bath
